page.title: 07Customs cider and cheese
page.content: One of the local customs is cidermaking. The best cider is made from apples especially grown for this purpose; they are sweet and juicy but also slightly bitter tasting. To make the cider the farmer gathers all the apples and puts them in a crusher. The apple pulp is then placed in a cider press in between layers of clean straw. This is called a cheese. The cheese is pressed down and the juice is collected into wooden barrels and allowed to ferment for about three months. The bigger the barrelful the better th cider becomes! A locally made cheese is the Dorset vinny a blue veined cheese eaten with Dorset Knobs.
